items.from_string:
"As a MLOPs engineer I want to run the TERA prod job to refresh records so that recent veteran records can be added without possibly disrupting the data if the database freezes."
- AC: Start the TERA prod job during a time when it will not disrupt users and monitor
items.to_string:
Title: TERA: Add Tera Jenkins jobs to preprod and update API gateway endpointValue Statement:
"As a MLOPs engineer I want to add the NRT TERA ci/cd process to the preprod environment to allow deployment of endpoints in preprod"AC:
 - NRT build + NRT deploy added to preprod
- API gateway updated

items.from_string:
Title: SCC: Create M21 Knowledge Base in Stage and Pre-Prod

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to create M21 Knowledge Base instances in the stage and pre-prod environments so that the same content and configuration available in dev can be validated and tested across higher environments before production deployment.

Acceptance Criteria: M21 Knowledge Base instances are created in stage and pre-prod. Each instance mirrors the structure, content, and configuration of the dev M21 Knowledge Base. Data sources and ingestion pipelines are connected and verified in both environments. Environment-specific parameters (roles, ARNs, bucket paths, IDs) are correctly configured. SCC tenants are checked to ensure they have corresponding KB access privileges in stage and pre-prod. End-to-end validation confirms that stage and pre-prod knowledge bases return responses consistent with dev.
items.to_string: Title: SCC: Support Promotion to Stage in November Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to promote the SCC ingestion workflow—including the SageMaker pipeline and all related components—from dev to stage so that SCC can validate the full scraping, parsing, and M21 KB update process in a production-like environment ahead of November deployment. Acceptance Criteria: A new SageMaker pipeline is created in stage mirroring the existing dev pipeline (scraping → parsing → M21 KB update). A new script processor is created in stage with updated ARNs, roles, and environment variables. The stage pipeline can access the stage M21 Knowledge Base, including correct KB IDs, data source IDs, and Bedrock agent endpoints. Jenkins is updated to run the pipeline in stage instead of dev (new job or updated job, depending on SCC conventions). All IAM roles, execution profiles, and policies required for pipeline execution in stage are verified and functional. SCC tenants are checked to ensure they have all required privileges for accessing the stage KB and any linked S3 or Bedrock resources. End-to-end validation confirms that the pipeline runs successfully in stage and updates the stage KB with expected output. Logs confirm successful execution of each step (scraping, parsing, KB update).

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a DevOps engineer, I want to integrate Fortify SCA (Static Code Analysis) scanning into the image builder pipeline managed by Harness So that application code are analyzed for security vulnerabilities and compliance issues during the CI/CD process.

Acceptance Criteria: The Fortify scanning step template is referenced and configured within the Harness image builder pipeline YAML or UI pipeline configuration. The template step is supplied with required parameters (e.g., image to scan, credentials/secrets, scan policy). The Fortify scan executes as part of the pipeline, analyzing the required artifacts (such as source code). Vulnerability scan results are captured, stored as artifacts/logs, and are visible in the Harness pipeline execution details.
items.to_string:
**As** a DevOps engineer, **I want** to integrate the Stage Delegate component into the Image Builder pipeline in Harness, **So that** stage-specific tasks can be executed in their appropriate environments, enabling more flexible, secure, and isolated image building and deployment workflows.
 
**Acceptance Criteria:** 1. The Image Builder pipeline is updated to include a stage where a Stage Delegate is selected and used for execution. 2. The pipeline can dynamically select and utilize different Stage Delegates depending on the target environment (e.g., dev, stage, prod). 3. Delegate logs are accessible through the Harness pipeline UI for traceability and troubleshooting. 4. Secure handling of secrets and environment-specific configurations is ensured via the Stage Delegate.

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant on the SCC team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user from SCC requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed.
Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved.
Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.

Acceptance Criteria: - Create an SOP that team members can use to help them create Eventbridges.

Value Statement:
As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who optimizes Bedrock model performance for tenants, I need to integrate the prompt caching functionality from the tutorial notebook into MLKit so that tenants can leverage prompt caching directly through the Bedrock Manager to reduce latency and token costs in production workloads.

Acceptance Criteria:
-When prompt caching logic from the tutorial notebook is incorporated, users have the ability to enable and manage prompt caching through MLKit’s BedrockManager class.
-MLKit supports validation of invocation requests leveraging prompt caching (e.g., cache hits vs. misses).
-The Bedrock tutorial notebook is updated to demonstrate the new MLKit-based prompt caching functionality.

As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who wants to add deploy a strands agent to a lambda, I want a reusable template script to deploy it. 

Acceptance Criteria:
- Script created that takes in existing provisioned Lambda, updates it with code
Support the creation of upcoming PI initiatives and PI demo prep

items.from_string: Integrate Cosign into Image Builder Pipeline for Image Signing with BIP Signing Key
items.to_string:
As a DevOps engineer,
I want to integrate Cosign into the image builder pipeline
So that every image built in the pipeline is automatically signed with the BIP signing key, enabling secure verification of images.

Acceptance Criteria:

The image builder pipeline is updated to include a step that invokes Cosign for image signing.
The BIP signing private key is securely managed and injected into the pipeline using a secrets manager.
After the container image is built, Cosign signs the image using the BIP signing key before it is pushed to the image registry (e.g., ECR).
The generated signature is stored as part of the image in the OCI registry or as an attached artifact.
The pipeline build fails if the signing step does not complete successfully.

As a user of our CI/CD platform,
I want to validate that Harness pipeline executor roles—provisioned by the Platform and Accelerators teams—have the correct permissions and access,
So that pipelines execute successfully and securely, and only have the privileges required for their tasks.


Create and run a test Harness pipeline using a service account or assumed role associated with the new executor roles.
Pipeline successfully executes all its steps, including:
Checking out source code
Building and pushing Docker images (if applicable)
Deploying to the relevant AWS/GCP/Azure resources (as applicable)
Fetching and updating secrets/parameters from secret stores or parameter stores (as applicable)
Validate that the executor role:
Cannot access resources beyond its intended scope (principle of least privilege)
Only has permissions required for pipeline operations

Attempt a step that should be denied (intentional overreach) and confirm access is denie

items.from_string: Enable mlops-admins SSM access via SBX proxy to improve infra testing
items.to_string:
**Story:** As a BIP-AI Infra Cloud Engineer, I want to start an SSM session to BIP domains via the SBX proxy using the mlops-admins role so that I can administer and view BIP tools from a contractor machine and enhance infrastructure testing capabilities.

## Assumptions

- SBX SSM proxy is already deployed and operational
- Current mlops-admins role lacks required SSM session permissions
- No other roles require this access in this story

## Acceptance Criteria

- **Given** an engineer authenticated via ADFS with the mlops-admins role **when** initiating an SSM StartSession to the SBX proxy instance **then** the session establishes successfully

- **Given** an established SSM session via the SBX proxy **when** accessing approved BIP tool domains **then** each domain responds successfully

- **Given** updated mlops-admins role policies **when** inspected **then** they include only the minimum required SSM actions (StartSession, DescribeSessions, TerminateSession) scoped to SBX proxy resources

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Updated policies deployed to DEV/SBX role via IaC

items.from_string: Create comprehensive SSM proxy user guide to enable team self-service access
items.to_string:
**Story:** As a BIP-AI Infra Cloud Engineer, I want a step-by-step user guide for accessing BIP domains via the SBX proxy so that team members can independently utilize the proxy for infrastructure testing and administration.

## Assumptions

- SSM proxy access permissions are already configured for mlops-admins role
- Team members have basic familiarity with AWS CLI and SSM concepts
- Confluence is the preferred documentation platform for team guides
- Both MacOS and Windows users exist on the team

## Acceptance Criteria

- **Given** a team member with mlops-admins role **when** following the user guide prerequisites **then** all required tools and permissions are properly configured

- **Given** the user guide **when** a MacOS user follows the step-by-step instructions **then** they successfully establish an SSM session to the SBX proxy and access BIP domains

- **Given** the user guide **when** a Windows user follows the step-by-step instructions **then** they successfully establish an SSM session to the SBX proxy and access BIP domains

- **Given** each documented step **when** tested by the author **then** the step executes successfully and produces the expected outcome

- **Given** the completed guide **when** published to Confluence **then** it is accessible to all team members and includes proper tags for discoverability

- **Given** the guide publication **when** shared with the team **then** notification is sent via appropriate team communication channels

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Guide includes comprehensive prerequisites section
- [ ] Platform-specific instructions provided for MacOS and Windows where differences exist
- [ ] All steps tested and validated by author
- [ ] Guide published to Confluence with proper formatting and navigation
- [ ] Team notification completed
- [ ] Stretch goal: One MacOS and one Windows user successfully tested the guide (if time permits)
This issue is cloned by BIP-29442

items.from_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-29442
Develop Grafana Panel composition to automate tenant panel deployments
items.to_string:
**Story:** As an MLOps Engineer, I want a Crossplane composition for Grafana dashboards so that dashboard deployments are automated as part of tenant intake and reduce manual deployment overhead.

## Assumptions

- Grafana provider is available and configured in the Crossplane environment
- Dashboard JSON bodies are developed separately from this automation
- Tenant intake process exists and can incorporate new claim templates
- SBX environment is available for testing composition functionality
- Environment-specific templating requirements are limited to naming and basic configuration differences

## Acceptance Criteria

- **Given** a dashboard JSON body **when** a tenant claim is submitted with Grafana enabled **then** the dashboard deploys automatically to the tenant's Grafana instance within 5 minutes

- **Given** a tenant claim **when** the Grafana enable/disable flag is set to disabled **then** no Grafana dashboard resources are created or deployed

- **Given** the composition **when** deployed to different environments **then** automatic naming follows environment-specific conventions and templating logic applies appropriate environment configurations

- **Given** the composite resource definition **when** validated **then** it includes all required fields for dashboard deployment and follows Crossplane CRD best practices

- **Given** the claim template **when** integrated into tenant intake **then** it provides clear enable/disable options and required dashboard configuration parameters

- **Given** the composition **when** tested in SBX environment **then** both claim deployment and composition deployment complete successfully with proper resource creation

- **Given** a failed dashboard deployment **when** the composition processes the claim **then** appropriate error conditions are surfaced and the claim status reflects the failure state

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Composition, CompositeResourceDefinition, and claim template developed
- [ ] Enable/disable flag functionality implemented and tested
- [ ] Automatic naming and environment-based templating implemented
- [ ] SBX environment testing completed successfully
- [ ] Documentation updated for composition usage and claim integration

items.from_string: Update agentic module with trace logging
items.to_string: Add Trace Logging Support to Agentic Module

Value Statement:
As BIP-AI engineers and tenants who require visibility into each step of a Strands Agents request, we need the ability to generate detailed trace logs within the Agentic module so that we can perform deeper debugging and improve  Gen-AI  observability for all tenants.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When a Strands Agents request is executed, trace-level logs are generated and accessible through the updated Agentic module.
- The MLKit logger class is updated to support trace parsing, and the Agentic module integrates these new logger methods.
- The tenant resource notebook is refactored to use the updated Agentic module and successfully validates trace logging.

As a ml engineer I want to add the image build step to the lambda deployment code to simplify processes

AC:
Jenkins stage added to build a image from a dockerfile in a repo to push to ecr for a lambda to use

items.from_string: Update Bedrock module with trace logging
items.to_string: Add Trace Logging Support to Bedrock Module

Value Statement:
As BIP-AI engineers and tenants who require visibility into each step of a Bedrock Agents request, we need the ability to generate detailed trace logs within the Bedrock module so that we can perform deeper debugging and improve  Gen-AI  observability for all tenants.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When a Bedrock Agents request is executed, trace-level logs are generated and accessible through the updated Bedrock module.
- The MLKit logger class is updated to support trace parsing, and the Bedrock module integrates these new logger methods.
- The tenant resource notebook is refactored to use the updated Bedrock module and successfully validates trace logging.

As a solutions engineer I want to upgrade the python version in the lambda image to standardize across platform

 

AC:

Lambda image is upgraded to Python 3.12 version

As a ml engineer I want to add to BIP AI kit a way to log jsons to cloudwatch for grafana to extract fields

AC: 
Function added to bip ai kit to log a dictionary in cloudwatch and logs

**As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to implement the Auto-tagger as composition to take advantage of Crossplane features** 

**A/C:**

- Implement the Auto-Tagger system as composition and test the deployment through Crossplane
This issue is cloned by BIP-29267
Research Infra Control panel for improved access

**As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to research the options and possibilities for developing a single infrastructure control panel** 

**A/C:**

- Research options to develop an infrastructure control panel which would give access to team members to run and control the platform through a Gateway accessible panel

items.from_string: Set up Grafana alerts for Bedrock inference requests
items.to_string: Add Bedrock Inference Request Metrics to Grafana MLOps Dashboard

Value Statement:
As a BIP-AI engineer who monitors tenant Bedrock usage, I need the ability to view Bedrock inference request metrics on the Grafana MLOps dashboard so that I can identify usage trends across all tenants and detect potential service quota limitations.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When tenants generate Bedrock inference requests, the updated Grafana MLOps dashboard displays the relevant request metrics.
- Dashboard panels are added or updated to show Bedrock inference request counts for all tenants, including appropriate filtering and aggregation.
- Manual tests validate that the metrics populate correctly and update in near real time.

items.from_string: Prototype AOSS collections via Crossplane IaC to enable automated Knowledge Base creation
items.to_string:
Story: As a BIP-AI tenant, I want to create OpenSearch Serverless collections through Crossplane Infrastructure as Code so that I can automatically provision the required backend storage for my Knowledge Bases without manual intervention.

Assumptions:

Knowledge Base IaC is already implemented and can accept AOSS collection references as input
OpenSearch Serverless provider for Crossplane is available and functional
SBX environment is available for testing
Acceptance Criteria:

Given an OpenSearch provider configuration when I create a test managed resource then the AOSS collection is provisioned successfully within 10 minutes
Given a provisioned AOSS collection when I reference it in Knowledge Base IaC then the KB deploys successfully and can access the collection
Given a working prototype when I integrate collection creation into the KB composition then collections are automatically created alongside Knowledge Bases
Given the integrated solution when I deploy in SBX environment then both AOSS collection and Knowledge Base are created together without manual steps
Given any collection creation or KB deployment when the process completes then appropriate telemetry events are recorded for monitoring
Definition of Done:

All acceptance criteria met
Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable)
Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable)
Telemetry / logging added (if applicable)
Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable)
Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable)
Dependencies:

Knowledge Base IaC implementation must be complete and functional
OpenSearch Serverless Crossplane provider must be available

items.to_string:
Story: As a BIP-AI tenant, I want to create OpenSearch Serverless collections through Crossplane Infrastructure as Code so that I can automatically provision the required backend storage for my Knowledge Bases without manual intervention.

Assumptions:

Knowledge Base IaC is already implemented and can accept AOSS collection references as input
-OpenSearch Serverless provider for Crossplane is available and functional- Serverless version of the provider is not currently available, new info in comments. Will deploy/test provider simultaneously.
SBX environment is available for testing
Acceptance Criteria:

Given an OpenSearch provider configuration when I create a test managed resource then the AOSS collection is provisioned successfully within 10 minutes
Given a provisioned AOSS collection when I reference it in Knowledge Base IaC then the KB deploys successfully and can access the collection
Given a working prototype when I integrate collection creation into the KB composition then collections are automatically created alongside Knowledge Bases
Given the integrated solution when I deploy in SBX environment then both AOSS collection and Knowledge Base are created together without manual steps
Given any collection creation or KB deployment when the process completes then appropriate telemetry events are recorded for monitoring
Definition of Done:

All acceptance criteria met
Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable)
Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable)
Telemetry / logging added (if applicable)
Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable)
Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable)
Dependencies:

Knowledge Base IaC implementation must be complete and functional
OpenSearch Serverless Crossplane provider must be available

Value Statement: As a MLOPs Engineer who deploys Bedrock Agents, I want the ability to execute custom deployment scripts from Jenkins so that deployments are flexible for any use case

Acceptance Criteria:
- Troubleshoot issues when executing EVA's deployment script in Jenkins
- Resolve issues with executing EVA's deployment script in Jenkins
- Add custom requirements install via UV, instead of just via requirements.txt

PR from prior ticket for context:
https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-ai-mlops-pipelines/pull/7

Value Statement: As an SE for the RatingSum team, I want to ensure their Sagemaker pipelines can easily be created and deployed so they can be more readily promoted

items.from_string:
Title: GenAnn: Create Sagemaker pipeline CICD for user metrics

Value Statement: As an SE for the GenAnn team, I want to ensure their Sagemaker pipelines can easily be created and deployed so they can be more readily promoted

AC: Jenkins pipeline created to deploy sagemaker pipeline into dev
items.to_string:
Title - Implement SageMaker Pipeline for VBMS User Metrics Extraction
Value Statement - As a platform member supporting the Gen-Ann team, I want to develop a SageMaker pipeline that reads user metrics from the VBMS database. This foundational capability will ensure that the data needed for future semantic enrichment (such as similarity scoring and analytics) is reliably ingested and made available, supporting consistent downstream analytics and quality monitoring.Acceptance Criteria * A SageMaker pipeline is created (in dev) with a single stage: reading user metrics from the VBMS database.
 * Database connection logic for source VBMS is implemented and tested.
 * No similarity scoring or write-back logic is included in this step.
 * The pipeline template/script allows for future extensibility to add additional processing stages (e.g., similarity scoring).

items.from_string:
Title - Implement SageMaker Pipeline for VBMS User Metrics Extraction
Value Statement - As a platform member supporting the Gen-Ann team, I want to develop a SageMaker pipeline that reads user metrics from the VBMS database. This foundational capability will ensure that the data needed for future semantic enrichment (such as similarity scoring and analytics) is reliably ingested and made available, supporting consistent downstream analytics and quality monitoring.Acceptance Criteria * A SageMaker pipeline is created (in dev) with a single stage: reading user metrics from the VBMS database.
 * Database connection logic for source VBMS is implemented and tested.
 * No similarity scoring or write-back logic is included in this step.
 * The pipeline template/script allows for future extensibility to add additional processing stages (e.g., similarity scoring).
items.to_string:
Title: GenAnn: Created Sagemaker Pipeline CICD for VBMS Analytics

Value Statement: As an SE for the GEnAnn team, I want to ensure their Sagemaker pipelines can easily be created and deployed so they can be more readily promoted

AC:
 * Jenkins pipeline created to deploy sagemaker pipeline into dev.
 * Sagemaker Pipeline is defined with 2 Steps: User Metrics Pull and Similarity Score Calc
 * After deployment, the pipeline runs and can be scheduled for future runs.
 * CICD changes to the pipeline can be easily deployed
